intro: Triticum unilaterale var. glabrum, commonly known as the smooth wheatgrass, is a variant of wheatgrass characterized by its smooth, hairless surface. It belongs to the grass family Poaceae and is native to temperate regions of the northern hemisphere. This plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and has narrow, elongated leaves with a bluish-green color. It is often cultivated for its nutritional value, as it is rich in vitamins and minerals. The plant is also used in traditional medicine and as a forage crop for livestock.
